column1: 64 year old man suffering from diabetes mellitus and hypertension. Dyspnoea, cough and hyperpyrexia for 3 days. Normal blood count and procalcitonin. High polymerase chain reaction (13.44 milligram / dL).
Multiple bilateral frosted glass areas with patchy distribution with prevalently subpleural distribution.
The contextual pharyngeal swab for COVID-19 was positive.
